Ah, that's pretty cool. Thanks for the link, Jeff.

On Wed, Aug 13, 2008 at 1:11 PM, Jeff Clune <jclune@...> wrote:
>> In the environments in which Sims and others evolve "walkers", they
>> are flat. But the creatures are composed of cuboids (which could still
>> form wheels, albeit not very easily). If the representation included
>> objects like spheres or rings and primitives, or as patterns that
>> easily emerged, it would certainly be interesting to see if rolling
>> behavior evolved in favor of crawling or scooting across a flat
>> surface.
>
> Check out this video from Hornby, where square wheels (or something very
> close to them) are used in a couple different creatures.
>
> http://ti.arc.nasa.gov/people/hornby/genre/genobots3d.mpg
>
> So, in these flat worlds evolution does seem to do something akin to a
> wheel....which is inline with your (implied) prediction. :-)
>
>
